intro: Fadogia salictaria, commonly known as the marsh fadogia, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to wetland and marshy habitats in Africa. It typically grows to a height of about 30–60 centimeters and features lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers arranged in clusters, which bloom in late summer. Its roots are often used in traditional medicine for their purported health benefits. Fadogia salictaria thrives in moist, nutrient-rich soils and is often found near water bodies.
